episodeTitle: A Barrage of Red Cards in Groggy Ring!
episodeTitleJapanese: レッドカード連発！グロッキーリング
description: During the Davy Back Fight's second round, Sanji and Zoro face the Foxy Pirates' fearsome Groggy Monsters team. Despite their constant bickering, the two rivals must work together to overcome Hamburg, Pickles, and Big Pan's brutal tactics and illegal weapons. After a hard-fought victory, Luffy makes a surprising choice that shocks everyone.

events.title: Groggy Ring Battle Continues
events.description: The episode opens with the Groggy Ring match already underway. Sanji and Zoro, despite taking damage from the Groggy Monsters' brutal attacks, show signs of recovery and prepare to counter-attack.
events.significance: Continues the second round of the Davy Back Fight, showcasing the rivalry and eventual teamwork between Zoro and Sanji.

events.title: Groggy Monsters Use Illegal Weapons
events.description: The Groggy Monsters pull out illegal weapons while the biased referee looks away. Hamburg wields iron clubs, Pickles brandishes two swords, and Big Pan uses giant metal pans to attempt a crushing attack.
events.significance: Demonstrates the Foxy Pirates' willingness to cheat and establishes the unfair conditions Zoro and Sanji must overcome.

quotes.speaker: Foxy
quotes.context: Foxy orders the Groggy Monsters to use their combination attack with weapons

events.title: Sanji Uses Troisième Hachis
events.description: Sanji unleashes his Troisième Hachis technique, a powerful kick that sends Hamburg flying. The attack is so strong that Hamburg crashes between Big Pan's crushing pans.
events.significance: Showcases Sanji's combat prowess and introduces a new technique in his fighting arsenal.

quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji delivers a powerful kick to Hamburg

events.title: Sanji Uses Bouquetière Shot
events.description: Following up on his attack, Sanji executes the Bouquetière Shot technique, further demonstrating his mastery of his fighting style and ensuring Hamburg is defeated.
events.significance: Shows Sanji's ability to chain attacks effectively and adds another technique to his documented repertoire.

quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji follows up with another powerful kick attack

events.title: Zoro Debuts No Sword Style: Tatsu Maki
events.description: Zoro unveils his No Sword Style (Mutouryuu) technique, Tatsu Maki, sending Pickles spinning through the air with tremendous force. This causes Pickles to accidentally slash Big Pan with his own swords.
events.significance: First appearance of Zoro's No Sword Style in the anime, demonstrating his versatility as a swordsman who can fight effectively even without wielding swords. This technique showcases his mastery and adaptability.

quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro uses his No Sword Style tornado technique

events.title: Nami Steals Referee's Cards and Whistle
events.description: Nami cleverly steals the biased referee's red cards and whistle, preventing him from issuing penalty cards against Zoro and Sanji. This levels the playing field and allows the Straw Hats to fight on equal terms.
events.significance: Demonstrates Nami's quick thinking and willingness to bend the rules when the opposition is already cheating. Her action is crucial to the Straw Hats' victory.

events.title: Zoro and Sanji's Combined Attack: Armée de l'Air Power Shoot
events.description: In a rare moment of cooperation, Sanji launches Zoro into the air using his Armée de l'Air Power Shoot technique. This combination attack demonstrates the duo's ability to work together despite their constant rivalry.
events.significance: A pivotal moment showing that when Zoro and Sanji put aside their differences, they can create devastating combination attacks. This teamwork is one of the episode's main themes.

quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji kicks Zoro towards Big Pan in a combination attack

events.title: Zoro Scores the Winning Goal
events.description: Zoro grabs Big Pan and dunks him straight through the goal, securing victory for the Straw Hats in the Groggy Ring match. The Groggy Monsters suffer their first-ever defeat in a Davy Back Fight.
events.significance: Marks the end of the second round and gives the Straw Hats the right to reclaim one of their crew members from the Foxy Pirates.

events.title: Luffy Chooses Shelly Over Chopper
events.description: After winning the Groggy Ring, Luffy has the right to reclaim a crew member. To everyone's shock, instead of choosing Chopper, Luffy selects Tonjit's horse Shelly. He promises Chopper that he will win the next round and get him back then.
events.significance: This is a significant anime-original change from the manga, where Luffy does choose Chopper. This decision extends the dramatic tension and shows Luffy's compassion for Tonjit, who has been separated from Shelly. It sets up emotional stakes for the final round.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy makes his surprising choice after the Groggy Ring victory

quotes.text: Don't worry Chopper! I'll definitely win the next round and get you back!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy promises to rescue Chopper in the final round

events.title: Tonjit and Shelly Reunited
events.description: Tonjit is emotionally reunited with his beloved horse Shelly, whom he had been separated from and who had waited for him for ten years. This heartwarming moment showcases the bond between the old man and his loyal companion.
events.significance: Provides emotional payoff for Tonjit's storyline and demonstrates Luffy's empathy and willingness to help others, even at the cost of delaying his crew member's rescue.

events.title: Setup for Final Round: Luffy vs Foxy
events.description: With the second round complete, the stage is set for the third and final round of the Davy Back Fight: a direct confrontation between Luffy and Captain Foxy. The episode ends with anticipation for this decisive battle.
events.significance: Sets up the climactic battle of the Davy Back Fight arc where Luffy must defeat Foxy to reclaim Chopper and end the competition.

themes.description: The episode explores how rivals Zoro and Sanji, despite their constant bickering, can set aside their differences to work together effectively when it matters. Their combination attacks prove that teamwork can overcome even the strongest opponents.
themes.symbolism: The Groggy Ring itself symbolizes the need for cooperation - a sport that requires two teammates to work in sync.

themes.description: Luffy's decision to choose Shelly over Chopper demonstrates his empathy and willingness to help others, even when it means delaying the rescue of his own crew member. He trusts in his own abilities to win the next round.
themes.symbolism: The ten-year separation between Tonjit and Shelly represents the importance of loyalty and the value of reuniting separated companions.

themes.description: While the Foxy Pirates resort to cheating with illegal weapons and a biased referee, the Straw Hats maintain their integrity and fight fair - even when Nami's theft of the referee's cards is a direct response to the opposition's own cheating.
themes.symbolism: The red cards that Nami steals represent the false authority and corruption of those who claim to enforce rules while breaking them.

mangaDifferences.difference: In the manga (Chapter 313), Luffy chooses Chopper after the Groggy Ring victory, immediately reuniting him with the crew. The anime changes this to have Luffy choose Shelly instead, extending Chopper's captivity for dramatic effect.
The anime extends and adds more detail to the combat sequences in the Groggy Ring, showing more of the techniques and attacks compared to the manga's faster pacing.

trivia.fact: This episode features the first animated appearance of Zoro's No Sword Style (Mutouryuu), demonstrating that he can fight effectively even without wielding his swords.
The anime-original decision to have Luffy choose Shelly instead of Chopper was made to extend the Davy Back Fight arc and build more dramatic tension.
The Groggy Monsters (Hamburg, Pickles, and Big Pan) had never lost a Davy Back Fight match before facing Zoro and Sanji, making this their first-ever defeat.
The episode's TV rating was 12.0%, ranking 6th in viewership for that week in Japan.
This episode adapts portions of manga Chapters 312 (pages 2-19) and 313 (pages 2-11).
